column28:
h4. *Epic Name:* Build the "Good Enough" Website

h4. *Description:*

The *Good Enough* website will serve as the central hub for consulting, research, and mathematically-informed programming strategy. It will clearly define and showcase the *Good Enough* methodology‚Äîstructured, provable, and reliable computational systems across multiple domains.

h4. *Core Branding & Structure:*

Everything will be organized under the *Good Enough* branding, emphasizing pragmatic, mathematically rigorous solutions:
‚úÖ *Good Enough Data* ‚Üí Data integrity, reproducibility, AI governance.
‚úÖ *Good Enough Game Development* ‚Üí Mathematically-driven game design, FSMs, procedural generation.
‚úÖ *Good Enough Architecture* ‚Üí Mathematical proofs in computational design.

h4. *Website Pages & Features:*

1Ô∏è‚É£ *Homepage:* Introduction to Good Enough methodology & core offerings.
2Ô∏è‚É£ *Good Enough Data:* Consulting & research in AI governance, test-driven data lineage, FAIR principles.
3Ô∏è‚É£ *Good Enough Game Development:* FSM-driven narratives, procedural generation, mathematical game architecture.
4Ô∏è‚É£ *Good Enough Architecture:* Proof-driven software design, computational metascience.
5Ô∏è‚É£ *Music Transition Page:* How structured thinking in music led to mathematically rigorous system design.
6Ô∏è‚É£ *Work With Me:* Consulting, speaking engagements, and research collaborations.
7Ô∏è‚É£ *Blog / Updates Section:* Thought leadership on mathematically-informed programming.

h4. *Goals & Outcomes:*

üöÄ *Clarify the unique value of Good Enough methodology.*
üöÄ *Attract the right clients, research partners, and high-level thinkers.*
üöÄ *Establish a clear, unified personal brand across multiple specializations.*
üöÄ *Filter out low-value engagements and create a space where structured computational thinking is prioritized.*

PROBLEM

Code is far more efficient if I solve the mathematical graph structure first.

SOLUTION

Fully define the finite state automata of the game nodes. Do not get sidetracked by computational definition of graph.

Start with most minimal example that utilises logic and extend from there. 

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA

AC 1. Define nodes & edges such that each state of a playthrough is defined.
